title: Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site: Photo Gallery
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Photo Gallery              Photo Gallery       Rehabilitation of the former Monroe Elementary School Facility manager Treva Harris documented the first phase of the rehabilitation which took place from 2001 through 2003.          Topeka Segregation Cases 1879-1951 Historian Thom Rosenblum has found images related to the segregation of Topeka's public school system from 1879 to 1951. To read more about segregation in Topeka, click here.      Forging Freedom's Pathway On June 11, 2011, visitors leisurely strolled with uniformed park rangers from the historic John Ritchie House to the formerly segregated Monroe Elementary School, meeting six costumed reenactors along the way. Beginning at the home of a prominent abolitionist and operator on the Underground Railroad and ending at a formerly segregated elementary school, visitors walked from the birth of the Civil War to the birth of the Civil Rights Movement in just under a half-mile.                               Exterior Rehabilitation 2001-2003   65 Photos  Photos of the first phase of rehabilitation/construction of the Brown v. Board of Education NHS.          Topeka Segregation Cases 1879-1951   8 Photos  Images related to the segregation of Topeka's public school system from 1879 to 1951.          Foster Case   6 Photos  Foster Case            Graham Case   2 Photos  Graham Case          Reynolds Case   2 Photos  Reynolds Case          Wright Case   26 Photos  Wright Case            Rich Case   6 Photos  Rich Case          Forging Freedom's Pathway   3 Photos  Images from the living history walk featuring characters from the Underground Railroad to Brown v. Board of Education.
